revised_title: The Pivotal Role of Radiocarbon Dating in British Archaeology
tldr: The author discusses the significant contributions of radiocarbon dating to the field of British archaeology. Radiocarbon dating has helped establish connections between isolated cultures, determine the age of structures, and link cultural stages to changes in the environment. It has also played a role in uncovering frauds and errors in archaeological findings. The author provides examples of radiocarbon dating's impact on Mesolithic and Neolithic cultures, as well as the potential for future research in this area.
